pages.title: What are Cycles?
pages.text: $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycles$() represent the computational throughput of your network.$(br)$(br)Unlike energy (FE), which is consumed to do work, Cycles are $(o)produced$() by doing work. They are an abstract resource used to quantify the processing power of your setup.

pages.title: Generation & Usage
pages.text: Cycles are generated by $(l:logicore:machines/server_rack)Server Racks$() and $(l:logicore:machines/computer)Computers$().$(br)$(br)The rate of generation depends on the hardware tier. These cycles flow through the $(l:logicore:components/data_cable)Data Cables$() and are essential for operating advanced network tasks.
